AboutUs.heading: About Us

section1.text: We are your premier, one-stop custom vertical print solution that proudly serves your area. If you’re searching for a high-quality wall printer with helpful, professional experts, look no further. We’ll work with you every step of the way to exceed your expectations!

AboutUs.section2: Do you wish your walls had a fresh new look? Do you dislike peel-and-stick wall art or traditional wallpaper murals for their lack of character?
AboutUs.section3: You want your designs to be both easy on the budget and eye-catching, vibrant, and high-definition digital quality as your preferences change. Perhaps it’s time to change perspectives. Wall prints allow you to make considerable design changes without breaking the bank.

WallPrinting.heading: How does wall printing work?
WallPrinting.intro: Wall printing is an exciting new technique that allows custom designs to be directly applied to walls. Here will explore the process of how wall printing works, combining technology, creativity, and craftsmanship to create stunning visual displays.
WallPrinting.conclusion: After printing, the surface needs time to dry and allow the ink to set properly. This can take a few hours or more. To protect the print, a protective coating or sealant may be applied to make it more durable.
WallPrinting.conclusion1: Wall printing combines technology and artistry to bring customized designs to life on walls. By understanding the process, we can appreciate the craftsmanship and creativity involved. This innovative technique opens up new possibilities for personalization, branding, and artistic expression in various spaces. As wall printing continues to evolve, it plays a significant role in the world of contemporary art.

section1.heading: 1. Specialized Printing Equipment:
section1.text: Wall printing starts with special printers designed specifically for this purpose. These advanced printers ensure accurate and high-quality image reproduction.

section2.heading: 2. Surface Preparation:
section2.text: Before printing, the wall surface is carefully prepared by cleaning off any dust or dirt. Sometimes, a primer or base coat is applied to help the print adhere better and achieve the best results.

section3.heading: 3. Digital Image Processing:
section3.text: The desired design or image is digitally processed and adjusted to fit the printer's requirements. This ensures the image will be printed correctly on the wall.

section4.heading: 4. Alignment and Calibration:
section4.text: The printer uses alignment and calibration systems to position the printing head accurately. This ensures that the design is printed in the right place on the wall.

section5.heading: 5. Ink Application:
section5.text: Special inks are used for wall printing to ensure they adhere well to different wall materials and withstand environmental factors. The printer applies the ink in layers, building up the image with precise detail and colours.

section6.heading: 6. Preservation of Wall Texture:
section6.text: An important aspect of wall printing is preserving the wall's original texture. The ink is applied in a way that respects and maintains the unique feel of the wall, so it doesn't change its texture.

section7.heading: 7. Drying and Finishing:
section7.text: After printing, the surface needs time to dry and allow the ink to set properly. This can take a few hours or more. To protect the print, a protective coating or sealant may be applied to make it more durable.

Question0.question: What is wall printing?
Question0.answer: Wall printing, is an innovative method that involves using a specialized printer to apply custom designs directly onto various surfaces. This technique eliminates the need for glues or sticky components, ensuring that the original texture and appearance of the wall remain intact. It enables the transformation of plain walls into personalized and visually striking works of art, making it an ideal solution for adding character and individuality to any space.

Question1.question: What are the costs of printing?
Question1.answer: The pricing of our services is determined based on several factors including location, size of the artwork, and the quality of the image. Typically, our pricing ranges between €150 and €250 per square meter. However, for more complex installations, a setup fee may be applicable. For larger projects or multiple images, we offer special project pricing. This allows us to tailor the pricing according to the specific requirements and scope of the project, ensuring that you receive a fair and competitive price for our services.

Question2.question: How long is the printing job?
Question2.answer: The production time for your artwork can vary depending on its size. Smaller pieces may take around 30 minutes, while larger ones could require several hours to complete. Our machine has the capability to print one square meter within an hour. It's important to note that setup times can also vary depending on the complexity of the project. This can range from 15 minutes for simpler setups to several hours, particularly if scaffolding or additional equipment is needed to ensure a successful printing process. We strive to efficiently manage the setup and production process to deliver the highest quality results in a timely manner.

Question3.question: What colours can be printed?
Question3.answer: Our printer utilizes the CMYK colour model, while conventional digital cameras and images found on the internet typically use the RGB colour model. Consequently, we will need to convert any images that use the RGB colour model before printing them. Although we strive to maintain colour comparability, we cannot guarantee exact colour replication. It is important to note that we can print white colour as well. Our wall printer is the only available option capable of printing white, which opens up numerous possibilities, especially when working with dark or coloured backgrounds.

Question4.question: What type of walls can be printed on?
Question4.answer: We have the capability to print on almost any wall surface that is compatible with our ink. This includes common materials such as cement, brick, and drywall, among others. However, the possibilities don't stop there. We can also print on surfaces like wood, tiles, and even glass, expanding the range of potential printing options.

Question5.question: Can you pint my own image?
Question5.answer: Yes, we can print images on our wall art. However, it's crucial to consider the quality of the picture as it greatly influences the final result. We generally recommend using images with a resolution of 300 dpi (dots per inch) for optimal printing quality. Additionally, please note that there may be restrictions on the height of the image to ensure the best possible outcome.

Question6.question: Is a designer required for the image selection?
Question6.answer: We are dedicated to assisting you in selecting the perfect art for your home. Whether you have a designer or not, we are thrilled to collaborate and work together to create the ideal design that perfectly complements your space. Your satisfaction is our priority, and we are committed to meeting the specific demands and preferences of your project.

Question7.question: What are the conditions and requirements for wall printing?
Question7.answer: Images can be printed for both indoor and outdoor applications. When displayed indoors, the colours of the printed images are expected to maintain their quality for approximately 10 years. For outdoor installations, the colour durability is estimated at around 5 years. Please note that the minimum ceiling height required for our printing service is 1.95 meters. This ensures the proper display and visual impact of the printed artwork within your space. To achieve the best possible print quality, we recommend using images with a resolution of 300 dpi (dots per inch) or higher. This higher resolution ensures sharper details and better overall image reproduction.
